Question: How can I calculate the sum of an array in Java?
Please using this api: Arrays.stream.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Arrays.stream
<<<code>>>: int[] array = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5};
int sum = Arrays.stream(array).sum();
<<<explanation>>>: The sum() method of the IntStream class returns the sum of elements in this stream. This is a special case of a reduction. This is a terminal operation.
Question: how to close a pop up window on a web page using webdriver: :<Insert question here.>public class Day4{    @Test    public void main() throws InterruptedException    {        WebDriver Driver = new FirefoxDriver();        Driver.get("http://live.guru99.com");        Driver.manage().window().maximize();        Thread.sleep(6000);        WebElement element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='Mobile']"));        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='IPhone']/../../div[@class='actions']//a[text()='Add to Compare']"));        Thread.sleep(2000);        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='Samsung Galaxy']/../../div[@class='actions']//a[text()='Add to Compare']"));        Thread.sleep(2000);        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//button[@title='Compare']"));        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//button[@title='Close Window']"));        Thread.sleep(6000);        element.click();        Set<String> windowId = Driver.getWindowHandles(); // get window id of current window        Iterator<String> itererator = windowId.iterator();        String mainWinID = itererator.next();        String newAdwinID = itererator.next();        Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);        System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());        Thread.sleep(3000);        Driver.close();        Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);        System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());        Thread.sleep(2000);        Driver.close();    }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:

Question: how to close a pop up window on a web page using webdriver: :<Insert question here.>public class Day4{    @Test    public void main() throws InterruptedException    {        WebDriver Driver = new FirefoxDriver();        Driver.get("http://live.guru99.com");        Driver.manage().window().maximize();        Thread.sleep(6000);        WebElement element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='Mobile']"));        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='IPhone']/../../div[@class='actions']//a[text()='Add to Compare']"));        Thread.sleep(2000);        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//a[text()='Samsung Galaxy']/../../div[@class='actions']//a[text()='Add to Compare']"));        Thread.sleep(2000);        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//button[@title='Compare']"));        element.click();        element = Driver.findElement(By.xpath("//button[@title='Close Window']"));        Thread.sleep(6000);        element.click();        Set<String> windowId = Driver.getWindowHandles(); // get window id of current window        Iterator<String> itererator = windowId.iterator();        String mainWinID = itererator.next();        String newAdwinID = itererator.next();        Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);        System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());        Thread.sleep(3000);        Driver.close();        Driver.switchTo().window(mainWinID);        System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());        Thread.sleep(2000);        Driver.close();    }}
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer:<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: String newAdwinID = itererator.next();
<<<explanation>>>: The next() method of the Iterator interface returns the next element in the iteration.
Question: How to handle multiple windows in Selenium WebDriver?
Please using this api: WebDriver.getWindowHandles.
Answer:<<<api>>>: WebDriver.getWindowHandles
<<<code>>>: Set<String> windowId = Driver.getWindowHandles();
<<<explanation>>>: The getWindowHandles() method of the WebDriver interface returns a set of all window handles that are available to the current driver.
Question: How to switch between different windows in Selenium WebDriver?
Please using this api: WebDriver.switchTo.window.
Answer:<<<api>>>: WebDriver.switchTo.window
<<<code>>>: Driver.switchTo().window(newAdwinID);
<<<explanation>>>: The switchTo().window() method of the WebDriver interface is used to switch to a different window or frame. The window to switch to is specified by the window handle.
Question: How to get the title of a webpage in Selenium WebDriver?
Please using this api: WebDriver.getTitle.
Answer:<<<api>>>: WebDriver.getTitle
<<<code>>>: System.out.println(Driver.getTitle());
<<<explanation>>>: The getTitle() method of the WebDriver interface returns the title of the current page.
Question: How to close a window in Selenium WebDriver?
Please using this api: WebDriver.close.
Answer:<<<api>>>: WebDriver.close
<<<code>>>: Driver.close();
<<<explanation>>>: The close() method of the WebDriver interface closes the current window.
